programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome to Episode 32 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon! We are ON SITE at Subaru Park in Philly to recap the PLL semis. We got a surprise appearance from Outlaws attackmen Brennan O'Neill. The boys recap the semis and look ahead to September 14th's dream matchup between the Outlaws and the Atlas.

programme.title: Outlaws
programme.desc: The Lacrosse Network Presents a look into on the 2012 Denver Outlaws Training camp, their first memories of lacrosse, the sounds of the game, and a recap of their Championship game with RJ Kaminski.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

He fakes his own death in order to avoid arrest and to lull his enemies into a false sense of security. It turns out Hollister is gunning for the brothers who murdered his family during the war. Unable to cover the $1.87 cost of the medicine, Barrett can do nothing while his wife dies. In an attempt to make up for their inaction, the townsfolk name Barrett deputy sheriff in an act of goodwill. Although Barrett accepts the post, he is far from forgiving of them and begins to plot his revenge.

programme.title: David Huntsberger: One Headed Beast
programme.desc: This stand-up special takes a unique approach with animated characters, including a robo-scientist and his human-animal assistants.

programme.title: Kathleen Madigan: Madigan Again
programme.desc: Her Irish Catholic Midwest family, pills in her mom’s purse, touring Afghanistan, an unparalleled love of John Denver…are all fodder for this special.

programme.title: Dominique Witten: Stop Me When I'm Lying!
programme.desc: The stand up comic, actress, and “Chappelle's Show" performer gives her signature hot takes regarding the life and times of a modern comedian.

programme.title: Rita Rudner: A Tale of Two Dresses
programme.desc: The famed Vegas headliner returns, as witty, insightful,and cutting as ever, as she riffs on life as a sixty-something in today's America.

programme.title: Joey Coco Diaz: Sociably Unacceptable
programme.desc: It's been 25 years in the making and now Uncle Joey Diaz is at Seeso for his first socially unacceptable special. Prepare yourselves, savages.

programme.title: Jill-Michele Meleán: White/Latina
programme.desc: The half-Bolivian, half-Irish comic talks about navigating vastly different cultural identities while creating her own brand of funny.

programme.title: Dennis Miller: Fake News, Real Jokes
programme.desc: The king of dry wit is back to take down the current political and social climate — from selfies to airline travel to Donald Trump and the media.

programme.title: Jimmy O. Yang: Guess How Much?
programme.desc: Yang dives into love languages, loser friends and negotiating with his Asian parents.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Minding the Monsters
programme.desc: The comedian and ventriloquist extraordinaire, along with this felt friends, visits a haunted house where hilarious chaos ensues.

programme.title: Whitney Cummings: Money Shot
programme.desc: Comedy Central roast veteran Whitney Cummings gets the stage to herself in this debut special, which finds the young comedian riffing on a wide range of topics, chiefly the differences between men and women and how both behave in relationships.

programme.title: Margaret Cho: Psycho
programme.desc: The comic provocateur tackles a new list of taboos—from race to sexuality to Boko Haram—in front of a live audience at New York’s Town Hall.

programme.title: Barry Brewer: Chicago, I'm Home
programme.desc: With over 15 years as a stand-up, Barry Brewer has a lot to say to his sold out crowd at the Studebaker Theater, where he recounts his life.

programme.title: Billy Sorrells: Toxic AF
programme.desc: Billy Sorrells discusses navigating divorce and surprise parenting twists as a dad of five, and being raised by toxic parents.

programme.title: Ezequiel Campa: Live and on Weed
programme.desc: The Argentine comedian explores various topics.

programme.title: John Hastings: Integrity
programme.desc: A live audience is treated to one disastrous day in the life of the award-winning stand-up involving an expiring visa, fighting friends and a murder.

programme.title: SXSW Comedy With Natasha Leggero
programme.desc: Stand-up performances include Baron Vaughn, Andrew Santino, Emily Heller, James Adomian and Moshe Kasher; Natasha Leggero hosts; the SXSW festival in Austin, Texas.

programme.title: SXSW Comedy With Natasha Leggero Part 2
programme.desc: The performing comics include Emo Phillips, Sean Patton, Ian Edwards, Kurt Braunohler and Eliza Skinner.

programme.title: Hal Sparks: Charmageddon
programme.desc: The stand-up comic discusses the perils of sexting, missed signals, and his hot takes on how to survive in our modern but uncertain times.

programme.title: Aaron Simmonds: Disabled Coconut
programme.desc: In this special, a BBC New Comedy Award finalist and wheelchair enthusiast talks about his beginnings in comedy and not being disabled enough.

programme.title: Tracy DeGraaf: Condemned Bakery
programme.desc: The mother of five shares the journey through the seasons of her life—from getting married and having kids to gaining weight and growing a beard.

programme.title: Aidan Jones: Taco
programme.desc: With effortless charm and wit, Aidan Jones muses on growing up as a mixed-race kid in Australia and meeting his biological father for the first time.

programme.title: Dino Vigo: All In
programme.desc: A skilled writer, as well as performer-Vigo seems poised to take the comedy world by storm and yet remains remarkably grounded in his approach to his craft.

programme.title: Michael Harrison: Overcritical
programme.desc: Michael Harrison overanalyzes various major life-altering issues such as flossing, decorative pillows, sports bars, and his immigration process.

programme.title: Pablo Francisco: Ouch! Live From San Jose!
programme.desc: ‘MADtv’ favorite Pablo Francisco shares hot takes on movies, music, celebrities, video games, obnoxious body piercings, and more in this comedy set.

programme.title: Erik Rivera: I'm No Expert
programme.desc: The charming and painfully honest comedian Erik Rivera’s stand-up comedy deals with relationships, fatherhood, and having strict immigrant parents.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In a continuation of the season premiere episode, 40 of the best home cooks in America compete head-to-head in the MASTERCHEF Battle of the Apron challenge, during which they will attempt the to earn a coveted white apron and move forward to compete for the MASTERCHEF title. The remaining home cooks must display culinary skills, as well as an immense passion for food, and be determined to out-cook their rivals and make the next round.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After the Battle of the Apron concludes, the Top 20 home cooks in America meet the first guest judge of the season – culinary icon Wolfgang Puck, who will introduce the season’s first Mystery Box Challenge. Each contestant will have 60 minutes to create a dish of their choice that features one of the world’s most fundamental ingredients – potatoes! The winner of the Mystery Box Challenge is rewarded with a significant decision going into the season’s first elimination challenge, during which they will have to replicate one of Chef Ramsay’s signature dishes in less than 60 minutes.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the season’s last mystery box challenge, the remaining contestants receive a surprise taste from home when they are tasked with creating a dish inspired by family. Whoever wins this challenge will immediately earn a spot in the MASTERCHEF JUNIOR finale. Then, in a juicy elimination test, the chef-testant who elevates a secret ingredient with the most finesse and personality will secure his or her spot in the finale. See how far the junior home cooks have come.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: A battle of the culinary world’s next generation comes to a head in this exciting two-hour finale showdown. The season began with 24 contestants, but now only three young chef-testants remain standing. The challenges this year were more intense, and more inspiring, than ever before. It’s a fight to the finish and only one will take it all home – the trophy, the coveted title of MASTERCHEF JUNIOR and the $100,000 grand prize. Watch as the home cooks dish up the best three-course meal of their lives, proving they have what it takes to win.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty gives a masterclass on the summer pruning of fruit, gives advice on maintaining ponds and plants up a pot to give colour and interest to last into the autumn months. Adam Frost travels to Brodsworth Hall in South Yorkshire to meet a head gardener who has been set the challenge of restoring the gardens to their 19th century glory.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits the iconic garden of impressionist painter Claude Monet at Giverny. As well as revelling in the beauty and colour of Monet's paradise at this time of year, he has a privileged chat to Englishman James Priest, who, just this week, took up his role as head gardener of this world-renowned garden. Back at Longmeadow Monty shares his top tips for growing key culinary herbs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the sweet peas he grew from seed earlier in the year and shows how to keep their display going on into the weeks ahead. Meanwhile, Rachel meets a couple from Hampshire who have created their entire garden around their obsession for one plant, the hosta. Elsewhere, Carol travels to Wales to find out how one man tackled his sloping plot to make a garden on five different levels.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots. Also, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows how to get the best from tomatoes planted in grow bags, Adam Frost tackles planting in a shady border, and Frances Tophill meets a couple who've created a garden inspired by their travels.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to the containers in the jewel garden, plants courgettes and clematis and checks up on his bees. Arit Anderson meets a woman on a mission to green up unloved and neglected outdoor spaces in west London, and Nick Bailey continues his journey through the world of the iris, this time turning his attention to Siberian and water irises.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team head to Birmingham for one of the highlights of the horticultural calendar: the annual Gardeners' World Live event.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants out annuals in the jewel garden, adds agapanthus to the mound and finds a new home for his pelargoniums. Adam Frost visits an innovative kitchen garden at the Spurs training centre in North London, which provides fresh produce for its players, coaches and staff. In Wiltshire, Carol Klein's at a glorious early summer garden which employs clever use of curves, circles and spheres in its evergreen planting.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants out sweetcorn, checks in on his container veg and creates a display with fuchsias. Nick Bailey visits a nurserywoman and gardener in Cheshire who uses perennials as the stars of the garden to provide interest throughout the year. With only a few weeks to go, Sue Kent shares an update on the progress of her first ever show garden, destined for the Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival. And there's a gardener in Somerset who couldn't live without roses in her garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles the perennial problem of what to grow in the shade beneath a tree, Carol Klein takes a look at the crocosmia and we meet a gardener in Derbyshire who has spent a lifetime growing and showing gladioli.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Longmeadow is in full bloom, but Monty Don is keen to remind viewers that there is still time to sow some late vegetables, demonstrating how easy it is to grow salad in a pot. It's time to give wisterias their summer prune. An expert, whose 252ft vine was in full flower just weeks ago, shows how she cuts back that summer growth. Meanwhile, Carol Klein has been out and about in Norfolk to revel in the bearded iris.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the summer gathers pace and the weather starts to warm up, drought-tolerant plants really hit their stride. Monty Don shares some of his favourites from Longmeadow and garden designer, Adam Frost, shows us how to build a gravel garden from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost gives tips on lawn repair, grows some unusual vegetables and plants a seasonal container. Advolly Richmond brings us up to date in her history of lawns by exploring the trend for ever more sophisticated machinery.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on plants to use for foliage with tropical proportions, Arit Anderson continues investigating the use of peat and Carol Klein explores Oxford Botanic Garden's euphorbias.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the sweet peas he grew from seed earlier in the year and shows how to keep their display going on into the weeks ahead. Meanwhile, Rachel meets a couple from Hampshire who have created their entire garden around their obsession for one plant, the hosta. Elsewhere, Carol travels to Wales to find out how one man tackled his sloping plot to make a garden on five different levels.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Millon-dollar barn find collection inherited by 3 sisters

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Chevy-powered Jaguar E-Type and a Ford Bronco Driveway Find
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets the details on a Jaguar E-Type with Chevy V-8 powertrain. Next, he heads south to discover a long-owned Ford Bronco that's been sitting in a man's driveway for quite some time.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $4M Barn Find - Rare Ferrari and 427 Shelby Cobra hidden for decades
programme.desc: Tom makes an incredible discovery! Behind the doors of a condemned garage lies two amazing cars, a 1966 Ferrari 275 GTB/2 and a 1967 Shelby Cobra 427. Follow along as Tom discovers, helps extract, and then attends the auction for these rare cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Prototype Mercedes Gullwing found in storage unit!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter brings us to a storage unit in an undisclosed location where an amazing prototype Mercedes-Benz 300SL Gullwing sits in completely unrestored condition. Tom then finds himself in California with some old Fords and Mercurys.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $900 Richard Petty engine, Ford Galaxies and a rare Mach 1 Mustang
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets "Snowball" Bishop, tours his personal junkyard, and gets some great stories about NASCAR and dirt track racing from the "good ol' days." Next, Tom gets the details on a rare Ford Mustang Mach 1 with a factory 429 Cobra Jet engine.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Subaru BRZ and Alfa Romeo SZ

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Millon-dollar Barn Find!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter helps "unearth" a 1952 Pegaso Z102, one of only 85 made, from a California garage. Next, we find Tom in South Carolina where he finds a plethora of American muscle cars, including a one-owner Plymouth Cuda.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Woodie Wagon craftsman and the story of Tom's Woodie
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets an amazing craftsman who has spent many decades restoring and repairing woodie wagons and is one of the last people left in the world doing such work. After that, we get to hear the wild story behind Tom's Ford woodie wagon.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by young up and coming guide Anthony Vargas, who puts them on a wide variety of game fish in the Keys backcountry.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Key West guide Nick LaBadie, a talented guide with a special knack for finding permit on the Key West flats.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by New York Cop Mike Counihan, who brings his passion for fitness and fishing along as the crew take on sharks in the Middle Florida Keys flats.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor rise early for a full day of adventure in the Keys, rocking the sunrise for baby tarpon, scoring on some mid-day permit, and watching the sun go down in search for big tarpon.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Central Florida’s St. John’s River is home to countless species of wildlife, making this sweet water estuary the perfect playground for a pair of river rats, Captains Jonathan Moss and Nick Clark.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Destination Polaris
programme.desc: Host Alexa Score is in California for Project X with Rugged Radios.

programme.title: Dirty 30
programme.desc: Dirty 30 is a groundbreaking docu-series filmed, edited, and directed by Eric Guarino. In this first episode, we follow Mike Iaconelli to the Bassmaster Elite Series on legendary Lake Okeechobee. As the camera rolls, we dive deep into the fishing world, shedding light on the industry and exploring the untold stories from Ike’s incredible 30-year career on the road.From behind-the-scenes moments to raw, unfiltered insights, this episode peels back the curtain on what it really takes to thrive in professional fishing. Get ready for some dirt, real talk, BIG FISH, and an up-close look at one of the sport’s most legendary figures.Folks at home,Celebrating 30 years in professional bass fishing is an incredible journey, and it wouldn’t be possible without you, the fans. Bass fishing professionally is really all about the fans, and I just want to say how much I appreciate every single one of you. I hope you enjoy the show!NEVER GIVE UP!!! — Ike

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: We sent Jay to the shark bite capital OF THE WORLD, it just so happens to be in our backyard. Watch Jay get shark bit in the scariest episode yet.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green heads to Yankton, South Dakota to learn about the history of the Missouri river and the people who count on the river for sustenance. The invasive carp are set to destroy this rich ecosystem and Kyle aims to stop this fish with his best weapon, a great recipe.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Great views, Food and people. Danny learns to fly fish on the iconic Madison River in Ennis, Montana.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: Host Ryan McVinney takes Boat Trader fans on an indepth exploration of Florida flats fishing deep in the backcountry of Islamorada. Featuring Captain Eric Lund, a Wall Street Broker turned backcountry fishing guide, this episode reveals the key design features of the world’s best flats skiffs and how they are built for targeting some of the most exciting sportfish species on the planet. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Florida’s coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. Some of the area’s most beautiful and secret locales show why Islamorada has earned the nickname of the Sportfish Capital of The World.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and George from Two Georges Marina battle the wind and tide on a tough day of fishing which leads Josh to fish another day, solely for revenge on the Sheepshead!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Denise Sanchez was awarded a hunt at G2 following our Hunters Extravaganza drawings. Its great to get to spend time on the ranch with new members of TTHA. Denise gets familiar with a giant and learns about new technology while on this hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. Laramie Barrett of Fortified Cottonseed joins John for a great weekend of hunting at his ranch in Uvalde, Texas. This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate – outside – in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is taking the Marine Surplus Console for the Aqua sport project and giving it a much needed face lift. They meet the team at Boat Outfitters to find an acrylic covering board to fit the console and cover the pre existing holes. They then head over to meet with crew at AwlGrip to get some ideas on color matching the console with the Aqua sport.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team take a trip to Marine Surplus in order to gather miscellaneous parts for AquaSport project such as cleats, rod holders, and a rub rail getting them one step closer to finishing the project. The crew then heads back to the project were they get to work on installing the parts gathered and getting the AquaSport accessorized.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The 2024 turkey season has arrived. Slade and Bentley are already off to a great start. Bentley managed to take one down opening weekend for youth hunt. And Slade took one down opening day. This episode features an inside look into Slade’s life filled with real eastate and the great outdoors.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we take you behind the scenes of production for one of the biggest and baddest listings Slade has ever gotten - Southside Land Company in Jefferson County, MS. Hunter Phelps comes down from Kentucky to help film, and Slade puts him on 2 Mississippi gobblers.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin invites life long PCB resident Griff Griffiths onboard and reveals the silver king migration is happening right in the midst all the beach-goers activities. Then ultimately landing his first local tarpon right on the beach he grew up on.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s no secret that sight fishing clear emerald green water is a favorite of local anglers when conditions are perfect. But perfection is rare. Justin & Travis share methods and techniques for finding and catching fish when the conditions are less than perfect on the beach and in the bay.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: What fish can you chase 365 days a year in almost any weather conditions in deep, shallow, skinny, stained or crystal clear water with a variety of baits and tactics? Justin & Travis illustrate how the Redfish is the go to sport fish that they will never get tired of chasing.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin has Humminbird’s Bill Carson onboard to show him how the new CoastMaster charts look in Panama City Beach waters and find it’s not just red snapper that populate these waters. It’s a smorgasbord of snapper for the cooler.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Texas isn’t all mesquite flats, corn feeders, and wire fences. Some of the most extreme terrain in the country can be found in the Lone Star State, and it just so happens that hunting opportunities abound for the adventurous.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After several years of shifting focus back to his native whitetails, Dahlke returns to mule deer country with the Muley Freak, Erik Van Woerkom. Follow along on this Utah mule deer hunt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didn’t just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys – and more importantly, the way we hunt them.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade shows us around some of his investment properties, and Ryan kills a nice bull elk in New Mexico.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade takes us around the hometown hunting grounds and shows us some of the last bits of preparation for the season. An old buck that’s been showing up on camera at night decides to daylight and pays the price.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike reunites with his South Seas comrade for a day of trout madness.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to the back, back-country where even the fish struggle to find water.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike tries to hold his own while fishing with Nick Fischer and Liza Fitzgerald in south seas Captiva. Good luck buddy.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon takes outdoorsman Zac Yarbrough to look for blackfin tuna and then out deep for swordfish. They are joined by Styles Haury for some epic offshore action.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Renowned Kiteboarder Mike Walsh goes out on a windy day with Brandon to see what they can catch around the iconic lighthouses of the middle Keys.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Get to know one extraordinary person who works on the show as we go fishing with underwater cameraman and boat captain himself, Garrett Stephens.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Jared Dieguz has been fishing all his life and now that he's running his own charter business, finding a day to "scout" the sea is more important than ever.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Central Florida’s St. John’s River is home to countless species of wildlife, making this sweet water estuary the perfect playground for a pair of river rats, Captains Jonathan Moss and Nick Clark.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Victoria shares the amazing progress she’s made after embracing the treatments made available to her through Operation Healing Heroes.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are at the dirty bird in Oklahoma kicking off the second day of bow season. Randy is already tagged out on a dandy of an 8 point we showed you last season in the “Camp Buck episode”. Joe Umphries from Big Tine is in camp and he is trying to close the deal on a buck he had a close call with last season at the Dirty Bird.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Rifle season is off to a slow start but things are heating up with lots of tags to fill.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Texas isn’t all mesquite flats, corn feeders, and wire fences. Some of the most extreme terrain in the country can be found in the Lone Star State, and it just so happens that hunting opportunities abound for the adventurous.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Whitetail deer have a unique four-chambered stomach that helps them digest tough plant material and adapt to seasonal diets. In this episode of Deer & Deer Hunting, Dan Schmidt and Josh Honeycutt break down the whitetail’s digestive system and what it means for you as a hunter.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Whether you're hunting 10 acres or 1,000, how you handle boundaries, buck movement, and communication with neighboring hunters can make or break your season. The team shares real-world scenarios and proven strategies to foster cooperation, avoid conflict, and build relationships that lead to better deer hunting for everyone.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by young up and coming guide Anthony Vargas, who puts them on a wide variety of game fish in the Keys backcountry.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Key West guide Nick LaBadie, a talented guide with a special knack for finding permit on the Key West flats.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by New York Cop Mike Counihan, who brings his passion for fitness and fishing along as the crew take on sharks in the Middle Florida Keys flats.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor rise early for a full day of adventure in the Keys, rocking the sunrise for baby tarpon, scoring on some mid-day permit, and watching the sun go down in search for big tarpon.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Central Florida’s St. John’s River is home to countless species of wildlife, making this sweet water estuary the perfect playground for a pair of river rats, Captains Jonathan Moss and Nick Clark.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Destination Polaris
programme.desc: Host Alexa Score is in California for Project X with Rugged Radios.

programme.title: Dirty 30
programme.desc: Dirty 30 is a groundbreaking docu-series filmed, edited, and directed by Eric Guarino. In this first episode, we follow Mike Iaconelli to the Bassmaster Elite Series on legendary Lake Okeechobee. As the camera rolls, we dive deep into the fishing world, shedding light on the industry and exploring the untold stories from Ike’s incredible 30-year career on the road.From behind-the-scenes moments to raw, unfiltered insights, this episode peels back the curtain on what it really takes to thrive in professional fishing. Get ready for some dirt, real talk, BIG FISH, and an up-close look at one of the sport’s most legendary figures.Folks at home,Celebrating 30 years in professional bass fishing is an incredible journey, and it wouldn’t be possible without you, the fans. Bass fishing professionally is really all about the fans, and I just want to say how much I appreciate every single one of you. I hope you enjoy the show!NEVER GIVE UP!!! — Ike

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: We sent Jay to the shark bite capital OF THE WORLD, it just so happens to be in our backyard. Watch Jay get shark bit in the scariest episode yet.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green heads to Yankton, South Dakota to learn about the history of the Missouri river and the people who count on the river for sustenance. The invasive carp are set to destroy this rich ecosystem and Kyle aims to stop this fish with his best weapon, a great recipe.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Great views, Food and people. Danny learns to fly fish on the iconic Madison River in Ennis, Montana.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: Host Ryan McVinney takes Boat Trader fans on an indepth exploration of Florida flats fishing deep in the backcountry of Islamorada. Featuring Captain Eric Lund, a Wall Street Broker turned backcountry fishing guide, this episode reveals the key design features of the world’s best flats skiffs and how they are built for targeting some of the most exciting sportfish species on the planet. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Florida’s coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. Some of the area’s most beautiful and secret locales show why Islamorada has earned the nickname of the Sportfish Capital of The World.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and George from Two Georges Marina battle the wind and tide on a tough day of fishing which leads Josh to fish another day, solely for revenge on the Sheepshead!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Denise Sanchez was awarded a hunt at G2 following our Hunters Extravaganza drawings. Its great to get to spend time on the ranch with new members of TTHA. Denise gets familiar with a giant and learns about new technology while on this hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. Laramie Barrett of Fortified Cottonseed joins John for a great weekend of hunting at his ranch in Uvalde, Texas. This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. programme.desc: A cop (Chuck Norris) exacts revenge on those who wronged him by going undercover as a hit man.

programme.title: Stroker Ace

programme.title: Prairie Home Companion
programme.desc: From director Robert Altman comes his final film, the deeply moving and comedic "A Prairie Home Companion".

programme.title: Sesame Street Presents: Follow That Bird
programme.desc: Big Bird runs away and all his old buddies join in the search to find him. Will Big Bird return home?

programme.title: Hero at Large
programme.desc: Foiling a robbery at a convenience store while wearing his Captain Avenger costume turns a struggling actor into a real-life vigilante crime fighter.

programme.title: Strange Brew
programme.desc: When a deranged Brewmeister plans to turn beer into a mind-control device, two friends must save the world.

programme.title: Over the Edge
programme.desc: Affluent middle-American suburban teenagers begin to see the flaws in their surroundings and lifestyles.

programme.title: Matchstick Men
programme.desc: Neurotic conman Roy and his protégé Frank find their latest scam disrupted when Roy discovers he has a teen daughter who wants to meet him.

programme.title: Get Smart's Bruce & Lloyd Out of Control
programme.desc: Nate and Lloyd tumble through the world of espionage, as the duo scrambles to recover a nifty new invention.

programme.title: Wilder Napalm
programme.desc: Sparks fly when two brothers, a workaday joe and a circus performer, who possess pyrokinetic minds, start fires and vie for the love of one hot woman.

programme.title: Finding Graceland
programme.desc: A grieving and guilt-ridden recent widower finds himself on a road trip to Memphis after picking up a hitchhiker who claims he’s Elvis Presley.

programme.title: Dick
programme.desc: After a class trip to the White House, two high school students end up becoming Nixon’s top secret advisers at the height of the Watergate scandal.

programme.title: Life Without Dick
programme.desc: After shooting her boyfriend, she meets the hitman who had been planning to kill him. As the two dispose of his body, romantic sparks begin to fly.

programme.title: Kabluey
programme.desc: To keep his brother’s family together during his deployment in Iraq, slacker Uncle Salman takes a humiliating job as a giant corporate mascot.

programme.title: Blonde Ambition
programme.desc: After small-town Katie follows her fiance to New York and catches him with another woman, she rebounds with a dream job that isn't what it appears.

programme.title: Lost in Yonkers
programme.desc: A film adaptation of Neil Simon's Pulitzer Prize-winning comedy/drama that follows the escapades and tragedies of an unusual family in 1942 Yonkers.

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: A young ad executive facing terminal cancer and expecting a child records his life's journey, confronting his past for his unborn child's future.

programme.title: Raising Waylon
programme.desc: A restaurateur (Thomas Gibson) and a photographer (Poppy Montgomery) learn surprising things about themselves while taking care of their 9-year-old godchild.

programme.title: To Gillian on Her 37th Birthday
programme.desc: After the death of his loving wife, David is torn by grief, and has been fixating on her spirit. Now he must let go of her in order to move on.

programme.title: Buddy
programme.desc: In this charming adaptation of Gertrude Lintz's autobiography, a brave, loving, eccentric socialite attempts to raise an 800-pound gorilla as her son.

programme.title: Whatever It Takes
programme.desc: A romantic teen comedy about the lengths that people will go to land their ideal partner—only to discover that reality doesn't live up to the fantasy.

programme.title: Sister Mary Explains It All
programme.desc: A confrontation between three former students and a nun forever changes their lives as the students turn the dogmatic nun's teachings on their head.

programme.title: Held Up
programme.desc: Everything changes for a bored bank teller who hates everything about his life the day two different gangs of bank robbers bust through the door.

programme.title: Year One
programme.desc: Banished from his tribe, hunter/slacker Zed teams up with gatherer Oh in travels that make them unlikely protagonists in a series of biblical events.

programme.title: Our Wife
programme.desc: A composer (Melvyn Douglas) goes on a cruise and meets a woman (Ruth Hussey) he likes more than his wife (Ellen Drew).

programme.title: The Ambushers
programme.desc: When an experimental flying saucer is brought down in Mexico, secret agent Matt Helm is sent to find it and keep it from falling into enemy hands.

programme.title: Oliver Twist
programme.desc: In this adaptation of the classic Charles Dickens novel, an orphan on the streets of London is welcomed into a household of trained pickpockets.

programme.title: How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life
programme.desc: A dedicated bachelor takes it upon himself to save his best friend’s marriage by seducing his mistress, only to wind up in his own romantic conundrum.

programme.title: Let Us Live
programme.desc: When a confused eyewitness identifies New York City cabbie Brick Tennant (Henry Fonda) as a killer, he is sentenced to death for a murder that he wasn't involved in. Though no one is willing to listen to the innocent prisoner's pleas for freedom, Brick's faithful fiancée, Mary (Maureen O'Sullivan), knows that her lover is innocent -- because she was with him when the crime was committed. As the scheduled execution draws ever nearer, Mary begins to investigate the murder herself.

programme.title: The Bedford Incident
programme.desc: Reporter Ben Munceford (Sidney Poitier) is aboard a U.S. Navy ship sailing near the Arctic Circle, on assignment to write a profile of Capt. Eric Finlander (Richard Widmark), a hardened anti-communist. Despite the concerns of Munceford, medical officer Chester Potter (Martin Balsam) and others on the ship, Finlander is shadowing a Soviet submarine on patrol in the same area, hoping to make it to surface. The cat-and-mouse game, however, turns deadly serious.

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: When a kerfuffle over fine wine exports upends their tiny nation's economy, the prime minister and grand duchess of Fenwick declare war on the U.S.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Man
programme.desc: Clumsy sanitation worker Red Jones (Red Skelton) is fired from his street-cleaning job shortly after his girlfriend, Ann Elliot (Janet Blair), refuses his marriage proposal until he betters himself. While training to become a door-to-door salesman, he accidentally stumbles into a murder investigation when the corrupt sanitation commissioner (Nicholas Joy) who had fired him is killed. When the murder weapon is found to be one of the brushes Red sells, he must fight to prove his innocence.

programme.title: Scandal Sheet
programme.desc: After accidentally killing his ex-wife, an editor of a tabloid newspaper discovers that his ace reporters are investigating the story.

programme.title: All Ashore
programme.desc: When they finally get some shore leave, three sailors head to Catalina Island and try to meet girls while pretending to be entertainers.

programme.title: First Comes Courage
programme.desc: Beautiful Norwegian woman Nicole Larsen (Merle Oberon) is dedicated to the local resistance movement, and seduces Nazi officer Paul Dichter (Carl Esmond) in order to gain information that will help to defeat the Germans. Complicating matters for Nicole are both the difficulty of her loathsome undercover work and the appearance of an old flame, handsome English soldier Allan Lowell (Brian Aherne), who would like nothing more than to reunite with her.

programme.title: Loss of Innocence
programme.desc: Left alone because of their mother's sudden hospitalization during a vacation in France, four British children have to fend for themselves. They stay at a hotel, where, despite the reticence of owner Madame Zisi (Danielle Darrieux), they are befriended by her lover, Eliot (Kenneth More). Joss (Susannah York), the eldest of the children, runs afoul of Madame Zisi, who thinks Eliot is spending too much time with her and causes a scene. Robbed of Eliot's attention, Joss denounces him to the police.

programme.title: Passport to Suez
programme.desc: Master sleuth Lone Wolf (Warren William) outwits Nazi spies for canal plans in Egypt.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: The long-standing bond between two small-time smugglers sailing around the Caribbean is threatened when a gorgeous siren seeks passage on their boat.

programme.title: Her Husband's Affairs
programme.desc: Advertising executive William Weldon (Franchot Tone) narrowly averts career implosion when his clever wife, Margaret (Lucille Ball), helps him save an important advertising account. But tensions run high in the Weldon household after William's fast-talking employer, J.B. Cruikshank (Edward Everett Horton), invites Margaret to work for him too. The cunning couple must compete with each other to write a campaign for Emil Glinka (Mikhail Rasumny) -- a mad scientist with an alarming new product.

programme.title: Under the Yum-Yum Tree
programme.desc: The machinations of a lusty landlord threaten the bliss of a couple trying to determine their character compatibility by living together platonically.

programme.title: Rockin' in the Rockies
programme.desc: Shorty Williams (Moe Howard) is put in charge of his cousin's ranch, but he is more concerned with becoming a prospector. He comes across two drifters (Larry Fine, Curly Howard) who just got lucky at the roulette table and befriends them as possible investors. Shorty also meets singer Betty (Gladys Blake) and her partner (Mary Beth Hughes) and convinces them to stay on the ranch along with the vagrants. Unfortunately, Shorty's cousin, Rusty (Jay Kirby), returns early and isn't pleased.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: Fools' Parade
programme.desc: The year is 1935, and James Stewart has been released from prison after serving a 40-year sentence. He wants nothing more than to claim the $25,000 waiting for him in a local bank, but the president of the bank doesn't want him to have it.

programme.title: Texas
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers Dan (William Holden) and Tod (Glenn Ford) look to Texas for opportunities when the war ends. Upon witnessing a stagecoach robbery, the close friends ambush the outlaws and confiscate the stolen funds. Tod wishes to return the money, but Dan wants to keep it. After a sheriff gives chase, each man runs off on his own. They are reunited after some time, but with Tod now an honest ranch hand and Dan an outlaw cattle rustler, the two do not know if their friendship can survive.

programme.title: California Conquest
programme.desc: A Spanish swashbuckler (Cornel Wilde) and a gunsmith's daughter (Teresa Wright) oppose a Russian plot to annex California.

programme.title: The Palomino
programme.desc: Steve Norris (Jerome Courtland), the heir to a meat-packing fortune, has a yearning to set out and forge a path of his own. His rebellious streak leads him to the broken down horse-breeding farm of the bewitching beauty Maria Guevara (Beverly Tyler). Enchanted by this determined young woman, Norris decides to assist her in saving her business. But this enrages duplicitous rival breeder Ben Lane (Roy Roberts), who steals away Guevara's prize palomino in an attempt to cripple her operation.

programme.title: The Texan Meets Calamity Jane
programme.desc: Calamity Jane's rightful ownership of a gambling hall is challenged but a Texas lawyer puts up a sensational legal battle to help her stay in charge.

programme.title: Reprisal!
programme.desc: Frank Madden (Guy Madison), who is part Native American but passes as white, purchases a ranch in the small town of Kendall, Okla. When Frank moves in, he finds that the bigoted townspeople have recently let three brothers, who are also his neighbors, get away with the lynching murder of innocent Native Americans. As tensions between the townspeople and local Native Americans rise, Hank becomes torn between fighting against injustice and keeping his true identity a secret.

programme.title: The Nevadan
programme.desc: After fleeing a sheriff's escort to jail, an outlaw thief crosses paths with a mysterious stranger and a greedy rancher en route to his stash of gold.

programme.title: The Texas Rangers
programme.desc: The Civil War has ended, the Union Army has pulled out, and now the Texas Rangers are needed once again to protect their state from harm. The newly reformed Rangers decide to take a chance by hiring a notorious outlaw Johnny Carver (George Montgomery). They offer the desperado amnesty for his previous crimes if he'll put his famous trigger finger to work for Texas. Carver agrees, but his new job won't be easy, as his old rival, the Sundance Kid (Ian MacDonald), is out for vengeance.

programme.title: A Man Called Sledge
programme.desc: In the Old West, a gunfighting outlaw connives his way into a jail with the goal of stealing a large shipment of gold stored in the prison.

programme.title: Banjo Hackett
programme.desc: Banjo Hackett, a free-spirited horse trader, accompanied by his orphaned nephew, travels the American West searching for a rare Arabian mare.

programme.title: The Range Feud
programme.desc: When a murder occurs during a range war, a sheriff (Buck Jones) investigates to clear an innocent man (John Wayne).

programme.title: The Outlaw Stallion
programme.desc: A boy and his mother are kidnapped by outlaws after the boy's stallion kills the outlaw leader's mount.

programme.title: Texas Cyclone
programme.desc: A traveling cowboy visits an unusual town where everyone assumes he is a man who was once presumed to be dead, including the man’s wife.

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: Dr. Allen Seward (Robert Francis) is the new doctor at a remote Army outpost. His liberal attitudes towards Native Americans become a source of tension between him and his superiors, especially Capt. Peter Blake (Philip Carey), who regards all Native Americans as dangerous and untrustworthy. Seward's insistence on treating several local Kiowa tribespeople for malaria further enrages Blake, who deems Seward a traitor when the Kiowa join forces with the Comanches and attack the fort.

programme.title: The Black Dakotas
programme.desc: A Confederate plot to turn the Sioux against the Union crumbles when a double agent makes off with a shipment of gold.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Angels in Disguise
programme.desc: The Bowery Boys go undercover to catch some unruly gangsters.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Smuggler's Cove
programme.desc: After one of the Bowery Boys inherits an estate on Long Island, the crew face a German gang of smugglers.

programme.title: Abbott and Costello Meet Captain Kidd
programme.desc: Abbott and Costello are on an island with deadly pirates.

programme.title: Wild Rovers
programme.desc: Cowboy Ross Bodine decides to join his buddy in robbing a bank to finance a comfortable retirement.

programme.title: Marie Antoinette (1938)
programme.desc: Lavish biography of the French queen who "let them eat cake."

programme.title: Time After Time
programme.desc: When Jack the Ripper steals his time machine, H.G. Wells tracks him down.

programme.title: The Super Cops
programme.desc: Two New York cops are sent to a crime-ridden section of Brooklyn, where they develop their own bizarre and amusingly extreme methods of fighting.

programme.title: The Outfit
programme.desc: After unknowingly robbing a syndicate bank, an ex-con demands $250,000 from the mob to avenge his brother's death in a dangerous quest for justice.

programme.title: The Tunnel of Love
programme.desc: A married couple endures endless red tape when they try to adopt a child.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Robin Hood

programme.title: CSI: Miami

programme.desc: Mac and Jack's mini-vacation is cut short when someone from their past abducts them and locks them in a concrete room; Matty tasks Riley, Bozer and Leanna with stealing a diamond encoded with terrorist intelligence from a princess in Milan.

programme.desc: Mac and the gang team up with a master thief to catch an underworld criminal who hired her to steal a dirty bomb.

programme.title: MacGyver

programme.desc: After a surprising introduction to Phoenix's newest recruit, Desi, MacGyver and team are assigned to protect a gun-sniffing dog who has a bounty on its head.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: The Phoenix must recover the body of a pilot whose plane crashed while testing an experimental laser mapping system that MacGyver designed; Riley tries to identify the hacker who tricked a SWAT team into arresting her and Elwood.
